items.label: prop-dalg-locality
items.title: Locality of Algorithmic Distance
items.content:
1725: :label: prop-dalg-locality
1726: 
1727: The regularized algorithmic distance $d_{\text{alg}}(j,\ell)$ depends only on the states of walkers $j$ and $\ell$:
1728: 
1729: $$
1730: d_{\text{alg}}(j,\ell) = \sqrt{\|x_j - x_\ell\|^2 + \lambda_{\text{alg}} \|v_j - v_\ell\|^2 + \varepsilon_d^2}
1731: 
1732: $$
1733: 
1734: **Consequence (Derivative Locality)**: For any walker $i$ with $i \neq j$ and $i \neq \ell$:
1735: 
1736: $$
1737: \nabla_{x_i, v_i} d_{\text{alg}}(j,\ell) = 0
1738: 
1739: $$
1740: 
1741: since the expression for $d_{\text{alg}}(j,\ell)$ contains no dependence on $(x_i, v_i)$.
